Articles.Content:
Greetings, gentlemen.

So this is a thread intended for the space flight simulator, Orbiter, a game in which you can fly all manners of craft into orbit, lunar injections and so on. It is similar to KSP, yet no so. As this game is free it may be liked by the people. You can find the main forum by just typing in Orbiter on google, and thusly get the game.

So, first question is, what spacecraft do you fly primarily and why?

I really should get into Orbiter, I know HavesteR loves the game, maybe he\'ll tell us about his favourite flight?

Hint: We want to hear from you Harv

I used to play Orbiter extensively. I really feel that KSP is the spiritual successor to it. It already has nearly the same functionality (besides docking). However, at the moment it is still really fun. The historical missions are really cool, like Gemini, and Apollo. Theres nothing better than recreating Apollo 11, or 13 if that\'s your fancy.
I have done a Skylab-continuity. Really fun to make your own space stations, and when docked, your cat hits the throttle, and your space station either goes into deep orbit, or reenter.
